documents.document: @neil_maltby very diverse bunch
@TriathlonPhysio I am with you on that.
@TriathlonPhysio I had never considered mindset for the concept of rehab - thanks Paul. Good thoughts.
@TriathlonPhysio I'm down with that! You think the concept of rehab can affect mindset?
@Brad_Neal_07 @Sinead_Holden very good points.
@gsingh1902 @benedsmith @sportskongres this was published. I will try to find
@gsingh1902 @benedsmith @sportskongres there was some saying about 80% suffer kinesaphobia.

@Andy_Goodall87 @neil_maltby it was opposite one so may have been better!
@neil_maltby should be around 9 most seem to say
@neil_maltby 6 months
@neil_maltby to early from last one?

The most under discussed factor in recovery! Does how you do depend on how you think you'll do? SR of expectations https://t.co/lDGWjLYhxF
Want to know why your prescribed exercises ain't gettin done? https://t.co/33Jl9CjSEE here are some predictive factors in neck and back pain
@DerekGriffin86 that would be my bias. They don't seem to see a correlation with psychological factors here though
@DerekGriffin86 Del do you think intensity maybe an important factor here and maybe why we see inconsistencies in previous studies?
@angiefearon @Peter_Gettings looked at full text and got the two groups. Thought you may have a within group measure of severity too
Really looking forward to this. Just need to avoid getting pissed.... https://t.co/YGcJrL4gya
@Retlouping the saying I hear consistently is you can lead a horse to water but....also depends how you lead it. Can it get back?
@angiefearon @Peter_Gettings thanks!
@angiefearon @Peter_Gettings what was the structural measure angie? I could not tell from abstract
@CPM_Sports You would have to ask them their opinions Chris! Mine is just a small voice in a sea of them
@tomgoom @SandCResearch makes sense! SAID principle in action. I often 1 skill X and 1 loading. Also depends on available equipment
@tomgoom @SandCResearch Hmm strange. Try this https://t.co/CM1yevKqaK
https://t.co/nZXzrOIRLz â€¦ Is there such a thing as a bad exercise? New blog! https://t.co/hdlxMuwWb8
@tomgoom @SandCResearch ha ha nice one Tom. Skill & strength seem to have different mechanisms of action. Cocontraction vs coordination
@CPM_Sports yes I agree. Presenting information is fine. Performing psych Evans and techniques not so
@mck_inst_aust We will have to wait for the paper that includes them!
@mck_inst_aust You feel they will prove to be useful?
@CPM_Sports would you be happy to discuss peoples beliefs regarding their body? Or do you feel that is psych?
@CPM_Sports I am not sure. Could be a bunch of stuff. Just physical factors IYO?
@mck_inst_aust https://t.co/pbmFVjjrG0 The credibility of subgroup claims in back pain trials is usually low,
@mck_inst_aust can we sub group effectively? Has it proven to be fruitful?
@RiturajP @markreidphysio @DanOsteopath @CombatSportPhys But if not equal how can we compare? Of course context is key. Thats the point
@RiturajP @markreidphysio @DanOsteopath @CombatSportPhys comparison assumes equality. How often do we see bilateral symptoms?
@RiturajP @markreidphysio @DanOsteopath @CombatSportPhys "subjective/objective findings eg could u do this before onset" so pre pain
@RiturajP @markreidphysio @DanOsteopath @CombatSportPhys So how could you get findings pre pain to measure against?
@RiturajP @markreidphysio @DanOsteopath @CombatSportPhys Do you see many people before onset?
@CombatSportPhys @markreidphysio @DanOsteopath @RiturajP Easy peasy! Not. Is one load a proxy for another?
@markreidphysio @DanOsteopath @RiturajP @CombatSportPhys how do you measure load tolerance?
@healthbyhowe if there is a pathology involved of course
@healthbyhowe very true. Might be it's not the answer anyway
Seems the current concept for back pain is 'just do some exercise'. Does this work with folk who are already active? Not so sure ðŸ¤”

@fizziowizzio yes whats Email?
@physiojack if we are normalising function then yes. Anything else you can piss off
@physiojack exactly
@physiojack surrogates might NOT change but function does!
@physiojack we often use surrogate measures but don't have an impact on function though
@physiojack I will let you have return to normal activities. The rest of it we never know what it was before!

Why do we always want to 'normalise' things?
What is normal anyway?
@UELSportTherapy They are mostly grey! Not sure where people get the black and white from!!!
@UELSportTherapy @Retlouping You might like this as well. Similar concepts around exercise https://t.co/mJcpZtZ76G
@Retlouping @UELSportTherapy I would like to update when i get time with Moerman's work on meaning and response because it sums it up really
@UELSportTherapy @Retlouping I wrote this last year https://t.co/D2YdPK4fWB Time to bin the placebo?
@UELSportTherapy @Retlouping The concept of Meaning and effect is much better https://t.co/IaOgudlfoU than the placebo
Redirecting the Thrust to Put â€œTherapeuticâ€ Back Into Therapeutic Exercise https://t.co/xCUisPYCnh https://t.co/5LoYUUEijx
@Pure_Physio is that always tissue/pathology specific?
@totallyphysio agreed ðŸ˜„. Seems that mostly the truth tends to lie somewhere in the middle!
@TaylorAlanJ @MattLowPT @RogerKerry1 @UoNPhysio thanks for weighing in ðŸ˜€
@TaylorAlanJ @MattLowPT @RogerKerry1 and rightly so Alan. We seem to have two sides in debate. Interesting this seen as advanced practice.
@musgrave_chris @totallyphysio @function2fitnes although you should point out its only about pain.
@TaylorAlanJ @MattLowPT @RogerKerry1 are thee the key factors in complex cases IYO Alan?
@EIPConsult @AdamMeakins you have such a deadpan sense of humour
@AdamMeakins maybe they died from poor posture?
@CWrightPhysio @PainCurious @Allpowersphysio why reconceptualising is needed but tough
@CWrightPhysio @PainCurious @Allpowersphysio exactly why bullshit flourishes. The need for a specific
@MattLowPT absolutely. I think it is a highly relevant discourse
@MattLowPT seems to be the two sides of therapy ATM
@MattLowPT is a diagnosis of something being 'sensitised' or 'irritated' ok IYO?
@MattLowPT such as imaging etc?
@CWrightPhysio @MattLowPT they want a reason as much as a diagnosis?
@MattLowPT do you see a 'diagnosis' as more likely to be able to provide than a 'clinical diagnosis'
@MattLowPT @RogerKerry1 @TaylorAlanJ I find it a fascinating subject
@MattLowPT @RogerKerry1 @TaylorAlanJ that needs to be hunted down
@MattLowPT @RogerKerry1 @TaylorAlanJ I see two sides. Those that might suggest sensitivity or pain as a problem, or more specific pathology
@MattLowPT @RogerKerry1 @TaylorAlanJ and all in 140? ðŸ˜„
@Allpowersphysio some might argue that you need more imaging or better diagnostic skills
@Allpowersphysio would you ever say I am not entirely sure what is causing this?
@Allpowersphysio would that always be a specific pathology?

Good folk of twitter.
Do you always give a specific diagnosis?
If someone can't, is because they haven't looked enough/used imaging etc.
